com.analog.lyric.collect

Class CopyOnWriteMap<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.collect.CopyOnWriteMap<K,V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Map<K,V>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CopyOnWriteConcurrentMap

    @ThreadSafe
@NonNullByDefault(value=false)
public class CopyOnWriteMap<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Map<K,V>
    A Map implementation that delegates to another map until the first time a method is called that will add or remove entries from the map. After the originalMap() has been copied (as indicated by wasCopied()), changes to the original map will not be reflected in this map.

    The map can be reverted back to its original uncopied state by invoking revertToOriginalMap().

    Until the first mutating operation has been performed, the map is only thread safe to the extent that the underlying map is. The implementation synchronizes against this object when explicit synchronization is needed.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface java.util.Map

      • originalMap

        @NonNull
public java.util.Map<K,V> originalMap()
        The underlying map to which this one delegates until the first time a mutating operation is called on this map. Set in the constructor.

      • revertToOriginalMap

        public void revertToOriginalMap()
        Resets the state of the map back to simple delegation of originalMap(), after which wasCopied() will be false.

      • wasCopied

        public boolean wasCopied()
        Indicates whether originalMap() has been copied. When true, mutating operations will not trigger additional copies and non-mutating operations will return the contents of the internal copy, not the contents of the original map. Changes made to the original map after the copy was made will not be noticed.

      • copyOriginalMap

        @NonNull
protected java.util.Map<K,V> copyOriginalMap()
        Returns a copy of originalMap() used the first time a mutating method is called on this class.

        The default implementation creates the new map using createEmptyMap(int) and adds members using Map.putAll(java.util.Map<? extends K, ? extends V>).

        Subclasses may override this method to return other map types or use a different copying technique.

      • createEmptyMap

        @NonNull
protected java.util.Map<K,V> createEmptyMap(int capacity)
        Creates an empty map with specified initial capacity.

        The default implementation returns a new TreeMap if the originalMap() is a SortedMap and otherwise returns a new HashMap.

        Subclasses may override this method to return other map types.

      • readOnlyMap

        @NonNull
protected java.util.Map<K,V> readOnlyMap()
        Returns map for use in implementing read-only operations. This will not trigger a copy. Use mutableMap() for mutating operations.

        Note that if wasCopied() is true, this will return the same object as mutableMap().

      • mutableMap

        @NonNull
protected java.util.Map<K,V> mutableMap()
        Returns map for use in implementing mutating operations. This will trigger a copy of the originalMap() (synchronized against this object) the first time it is invoked after construction or after call to revertToOriginalMap(). Use readOnlyMap() for read-only operations.
